dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apple just quietly killed its search engine project, right? Did you see that in the latest iOS update?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apple just quietly killed its search engine project, right? Did you see that in the latest iOS update?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game by building its own rival search engine technology, the Financial Times report, as U.S. antitrust regulators hone in on the search engine giant for allegedly abusing its dominant market position and deals with other big players like Apple.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, yeah—Android 14, they basically stripped out their own search results. Like, when you type from the home screen now, it just redirects through another engine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, yeah-Android fourteen, they basically stripped out their own search results. Like, when you type from the home screen now, it just redirects through another engine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the latest version of the iPhone operating system, iOS 14, Apple bolstered its own search capabilities with little fanfare, the Financial Times reports. The change went largely unnoticed, and included displaying its own search results and linking to websites directly rather than through another engine when users typed queries from their home screens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Microsoft's still the default—paying up to $4 billion a year for that spot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Microsoft's still the default-paying up to four dollars billion a year for that spot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the iPhones default search engine Google, who pay $8-12 billion a year for the privilege in a deal U.S. antitrust regulators are investigating remains unchanged, the FT says the change is an important advance that could form the foundation of a fuller attack on Google, according to several people in the industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which the DOJ is *all* over, by the way. That deal's under investigation for antitrust stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which the D O J is all over, by the way. That deal's under investigation for antitrust stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice sued Google last week for alleged antitrust violations following a 16-month investigation into the practices of big tech companies. The investigation included its multi-billion deal with Apple to ensure Google remains the default search engine on the iPhone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right! And Apple's not even hiring search engineers anymore. They even poached Microsoft's head of search a while back and then… nothing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! And Apple's not even hiring search engineers anymore. They even poached Microsoft's head of search a while back and then... nothing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though little is known about Apples internal projects the company is secretive, to say the least the FT points to growing evidence that the iPhone maker is attempting to build its own search engine, including poaching Googles head of search, ambitious hiring for search engineers, and increased activity from Apples web crawler, which could be used to catalogue online material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's like they're backing away slowly. Even their web crawler activity dropped off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like they're backing away slowly. Even their web crawler activity dropped off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though little is known about Apples internal projects the company is secretive, to say the least the FT points to growing evidence that the iPhone maker is attempting to build its own search engine, including poaching Googles head of search, ambitious hiring for search engineers, and increased activity from Apples web crawler, which could be used to catalogue online material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But why now? I mean, both these companies are knee-deep in antitrust battles already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But why now? I mean, both these companies are knee-deep in antitrust battles already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple and Google are both fighting antitrust battles right now that could potentially reshape the digital landscape as we know it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—Epic's suing Apple, the DOJ's looking into Microsoft… it's a whole mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-Epic's suing Apple, the D O J's looking into Microsoft... it's a whole mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice sued Google last week for alleged antitrust violations following a 16-month investigation into the practices of big tech companies. Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations after it kicked Fortnite off the App Store.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think this is Apple trying to avoid more scrutiny? Like, "Look, we're not even trying to compete in search!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think this is Apple trying to avoid more scrutiny? Like, Look, we're not even trying to compete in search!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly? Probably. They don't want another front in this regulatory war.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly? Probably. They don't want another front in this regulatory war.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And meanwhile Microsoft's sitting pretty as the default on a billion iPhones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And meanwhile Microsoft's sitting pretty as the default on a billion iPhones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the iPhones default search engine Google, who pay $8-12 billion a year for the privilege in a deal U.S. antitrust regulators are investigating remains unchanged, the FT says the change is an important advance that could form the foundation of a fuller attack on Google, according to several people in the industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For now. But if regulators break *that* deal up…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For now. But if regulators break that deal up...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, that would shake things up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, that would shake things up.
